name: Beta-Blocker Prophylaxis in Marfan Syndrome
description: Beta-adrenergic blockade is the cornerstone of medical therapy in Marfan syndrome, reducing the rate of aortic root dilation and decreasing the risk of aortic dissection. Beta-blockers reduce heart rate, blood pressure, and aortic wall stress (dP/dt). Losartan and other ARBs have emerged as adjunctive therapy targeting TGF-beta signaling. Current guidelines recommend combination therapy in most Marfan patients.

hemodynamic: Reduce dP/dt (rate of pressure rise in systole)
mechanism.target: Reduce impulse load on aortic wall during systole

metoprolol.dose: 25-100mg twice daily or XL once daily

titration.exercise_hr: Blunted response to exercise (<100 bpm with moderate activity)

shores_trial_1994.design: Randomized trial of propranolol in Marfan syndrome
shores_trial_1994.findings: Reduced rate of aortic root dilation and fewer endpoints

rationale.in_marfan: Defective fibrillin leads to excess TGF-beta activity
rationale.arb_effect: Losartan and other ARBs reduce TGF-beta signaling

losartan.mechanism: AT1 receptor blockade reduces TGF-beta activity

evidence.mouse_studies: Dramatic effect in Marfan mouse models
evidence.human_trials: Mixed results - COMPARE trial showed benefit, AIM trial showed no superiority over atenolol

compare_trial.design: Losartan vs no additional therapy (on background beta-blocker)
compare_trial.result: Losartan reduced rate of aortic root dilation

aim_trial.result: No significant difference in aortic root dilation rate

clinical_trials_summary.conclusion: Most centers now use COMBINATION therapy (beta-blocker + ARB)

current_recommendations.adjunctive: Add losartan if tolerated, especially if BP not at goal
current_recommendations.alternative: ARB alone if beta-blocker contraindicated or not tolerated

when_to_start.pediatric: At diagnosis, regardless of aortic root size
when_to_start.asymptomatic: Treatment is prophylactic - start before aortic events occur

postoperative_continuation.after_root_replacement: Continue lifelong - remaining aorta still at risk
postoperative_continuation.rationale: Distal aortic disease develops in 30% of Marfan patients
postoperative_continuation.dose: May need adjustment based on hemodynamics post-surgery

clinical_pearls: Start beta-blocker at diagnosis - don't wait for aortic dilation
Target HR <70 and BP <120/80 for optimal aortic protection
Most centers now use beta-blocker + losartan combination therapy
Continue medical therapy even AFTER aortic root replacement
learning_objectives: Explain the hemodynamic and molecular rationale for beta-blocker therapy in Marfan syndrome
Describe the role of ARBs in Marfan aortic protection
Apply appropriate dosing and monitoring targets for Marfan medical therapy
